{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents provide mixed evidence on the role of antiphospholipid antibodies in the development of avascular necrosis in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus. Some documents suggest that there is no significant link between the presence of antiphospholipid antibodies and the development of avascular necrosis (e.g., Document 0, Document 12). However, other documents suggest that antiphospholipid antibodies may be a risk factor for avascular necrosis (e.g., Document 2, Document 5, Document 21, Document 25, Document 30). Given this conflicting evidence, it is not possible to definitively say whether antiphospholipid antibodies play a role in the development of avascular necrosis in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus.", "answer_choice": "C. maybe"}
